TaxonIdentification.species_authority: (J. Le Conte) Kunth var . eulae (Shinners) Gerald L. Smith & Flory

treatment.description: Leaves appearing in late winter, withering in late spring before anthesis, suberect, to 5 cm wide. Scape bracts lanceolate, 4–5 cm. 2n = 52.
treatment.habitat: heavy soils near streams that periodically overflow and seepage slopes
treatment.discussion: Hymenocallis occidentalis var. eulae is in need of additional study. The type collection is in poor condition, and only a small number of other collections were available for study. The floral data now available does not justify recognizing this entity as a separate species. However, the presence of suberect leaves and their senescence before anthesis do indicate a degree of genetic difference that we consider sufficient to support varietal rank.
